reasoning: Notice that the polynomial \( x^3 - x \) can be factored. This insight allows for re-expressing the integral directly through its roots. It becomes easier to integrate if we rewrite it in terms of its factors.
The expression \( |x^3 - x| \) can be factored into \( |x(x^2 - 1)| \), which simplifies consideration of roots. A convenient substitution can exploit the symmetry of the function.
